    Over 250,000 people downloaded the free version of Junk Store. While not all will upgrade, we have to plan for the possibility that many will at least try the new version â€” and trying has a cost.

    There are over 5 million Steam Deck users. If even a fraction of them download the installer (which is ~100MB), thatâ€™s terabytes of bandwidth. And it doesnâ€™t stop there: each user may make 20â€“30 server requests per day, depending on usage. Those requests cost money â€” and at scale, it adds up very fast.

    We want every user to get a 7-day free trial â€” but those trials still incur real backend costs.

    Since we canâ€™t predict how many people will pay, weâ€™ve had to base our pricing model on the users whoâ€™ve already contributed â€” meaning their purchases need to cover trials, servers, and support.
